pages.text: For full details, see the Tampa Convention Center General Building Policies: https://www.tampa.gov/document/general-building-policies

The Office of Special Events exists to serve the community and to guide event planners through the special event permitting procedure. All bookings for special events, such as festivals, runs/walks, parades, block parties and citywide holiday celebrations that take place on public property are initiated with our office. We have created a user-friendly, one-stop process to facilitate a successful event.

Tampa Convention Center
AZA Annual Conference
AZA conferences have grown enormously over the years, from fewer than a hundred delegates to nearly 3,000. The conference program is geared toward the many disciplines in the zoological profession - directors, animal curators, keepers, society members, scientists, gift shop merchandisers, and practitioners in public relations, development, marketing, education, and government affairs will all find something of interest. AZA Annual Conferences are all hosted by AZA accredited zoos and aquariums. For event details: https://www.aza.org/conferences-meetings

Public Meeting Notice: Any person who decides to appeal any decision made with respect to any matter considered at a public hearing or meeting are advised that they will need a record of the proceedings, and for such purpose may need to hire a court reporter to ensure that a verbatim record of the proceeding is made, which record includes the testimony and evidence upon which the appeal is to be based.

About Us
Treasure Worth Discovering.
Located in the heart of Downtown Tampa, the Tampa Convention Center offers sparkling waterfront views of the Garrison Channel which connects to the Hillsborough River, 600,000 square feet of transformable spaces, and state-of-the-art amenities—all under the Florida sun.
Owned and operated by the
City of Tampa
, the Convention Center is overseen by Mayor Jane Castor and the City’s Administrator for Economic Opportunity.
The Hillsborough County Board of County Commissioners
, the
Hillsborough County Hotel & Motel Association
,
Visit Tampa Bay
& the
Tampa Bay Sports Commission
provide support to the Tampa Convention Center and work tirelessly to bring events to our facility and the Tampa Bay Area.
The Tampa Convention Center continues to be a major asset for economic development, hosting regional, national, and international conventions that stimulate the local economy. Our experienced team can deliver one-stop event solutions tailored to each convention’s unique needs.
The facility has four levels of space comprised of an exhibition hall, ballroom, spacious pre-function areas, and several breakout rooms. Cafes and waterfront gathering areas, including The Sail Pavilion and marina -- and visitors can see what makes the Tampa Convention Center one of the premier conference facilities in the Southeast.
In addition to the facility’s features and amenities, the Tampa Convention Center’s central location gives visitors direct access to some of the city’s top hotels, restaurants, and attractions. With so much to explore both inside and outside the Tampa Convention Center, we hope you will come experience this riverfront gem for yourself and see what makes this destination a treasure worth discovering.
Mission Statement
To be a major economic impact for Tampa and the surrounding region.
Vision Statement
To be an industry leading facility that promotes a culture of hospitality, service, and partnership
Welcome To Tampa Convention Center

Advisory groups play an essential role in city government. Advisory group members consist of Mayoral and City Council appointees, elected officials, or Governor appointees. Each group is established to secure the participation of City of Tampa residents to promote good government, and the effective and efficient delivery of services.

Contract Administration Department prepares and manages contracts for professional and construction services, including but not limited to, planning and design, contract execution, and construction phase administration, for City of Tampa capital construction projects.  Learn more about:

Boards and commissions play a vital role in the governance of the City of Tampa, ensuring public participation, oversight, and informed decision-making across various policy areas. These entities are established to advise on specialized topics such as historic preservation, budget and finance, law enforcement oversight, and code enforcement.
